intro: Dasycarya grisea, commonly known as the gray sponge algae, is a species of calcareous algae belonging to the family Dasycyrtaceae. It is characterized by its dense, sponge-like structure composed of calcified cells, which provide structural support and protection. This algae typically grows in marine environments, often attached to rocky substrates in shallow coastal waters. Its coloration ranges from gray to brown, depending on the environmental conditions and light exposure. Dasycarya grisea plays a role in marine ecosystems by contributing to reef structures and serving as a habitat for various microorganisms.
